content.question: The figure above shows the graphs of the polar curves <math alttext="r equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="r equals, 4 times sine theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the area inside the circle <math alttext="r equals, 4 times sine theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and outside the circle <math alttext="r equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.9: (BC ONLY) Finding the Area of the Region Bounded by Two Polar Curves

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
